docstr:
`BESSEL_Y0` — Bessel function of the second kind of order 0

### Description
`BESSEL_Y0(X)` computes the Bessel function of the second kind of
order 0 of `X`. This function is available under the name
`BESY0` as a GNU extension.



### Syntax
`RESULT = BESSEL_Y0(X)`


### Arguments

     
.






### Return value
The return value is of type `REAL`. It has the same kind as `X`.



### Example

     ```


program test_besy0

  real(8) :: x = 0.0_8

  x = bessel_y0(x)

end program test_besy0

```



### Specific names

     
 | Name             | Argument           | Return type        | Standard

 | `DBESY0(X)` | `REAL(8) X`   | `REAL(8)`     | GNU extension





### Standard
Fortran 2008 and later



### Class
Elemental function
